title: Vote with your wallets people!
body:
So lately I've seen a lot of posts on the boards about "game balance is the worst its been in awhile", "game sucks now" and nostalgia threads about seasons 1-5. If you feel like the game is taking a turn for the worst, then make your voice known by hitting Riot where it hurts the most, in the wallet.

Simply don't buy anything from Riot while you feel like the game is in a bad state. Eventually, they'll get the message and hopefully the game can get back on track.

Edit: Since several of you now have suggested that voting with our wallets might not work, and that not buying RP/skins does not equal having problems with the balance of the game, (valid point) what would you suggest we do instead, seeing as our posts on the boards don't have as much of an impact on Riot's balance/gameplay decisions as they should.

replies.body: The game balance is not getting worse; the perception of what balance is just getting worse and worse. People continue to make uneducated post after post which causes people in the community to focus on the negativity of the game. In a lot of these scenarios, the people making the complaints aren't even bringing up reasonable comments. Players continue to complain patches after a champ has been gutted, complain that champs that have poor design are being ignored because riot doesn't love them and use nothing but their solo queue experiences as justification. The community also has a bad habit of arguing both sides of an argument. "OMG I can't kill a tank" with the next forum post complaining that a tank dies in 1.5 seconds. If you think this game has gotten to the point where it is unplayable, take a break and stop playing. You need to learn that meta does exist and there is nothing wrong with a tier 0/1/2/3/4/X existing. The important thing is that there is fair interaction between players, and while this game is by no means prefect, this still very much exists. I will continue to buy skins and contribute to this company just so they know that their are people that support their balancing decisions.
Beautifully written.

> [{quoted}](name=Katorz,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=IKyYUuvK,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2017-02-16T22:08:21.813+0000)
>
> Beautifully written.

https://i.imgflip.com/1jv7am.jpg

jk, jk - it's just a joke, bro!

I completely disagree. There's always been broken champions and there's always been "bad metas" (black cleaver stacking I'm looking at you) but the meta always previously stabilized after a couple of patches. In particular, I always felt like I could play my favourite champions well and have a good chance of winning the game! After Season 6 and the introduction of keystone masteries, things got progressively worse from a balance point of view and I no longer feel like I can play any of my favourite champions in order to win - for the first time in League it legit feels like you need to play "meta champs" if you want to progress in rank which is very disappointing and takes the fun out of the game for me. Finally, Season 7 made things worse since the jungle was pretty stable in Season 6 but again got completely reworked removing two entire classes of junglers (AP  + tank junglers) making them feel terrible to jungle with so now you must also pick a meta jungler in order to ensure your best chances at winning the game. Then finally we have the most recent lethality debacle where instead of going for a reasonably incremental change from the 0.4/0.6 formula to a 0.5/0.5 formula, Riot decided to go full retard mode and change it t 0.6/0.4 making lethality broken again at all stages of the game (except now even  better late game) and we're back to having to pick AD champions again if we want a chance at winning the game. Woo \o/.
Pretty much this. ^

This post would be completely true before season 6, but now its just not. There have always been some meta shifts between something broken and abused, and balanced meta between them, but the game has been in a TERRIBLE state for over a year now, its just 1 retarded meta into another and is getting worse and worse, culminating in current lethality where its literally - play full AD lethality or you CANT POSSIBLY WIN. Riot needs to sit down and either discuss current state of the game or if their team cant provide us with some actually fun and inceractive gameplay, FIRE THEM ASAP because most of us could balance the game better simply from multiple years of gameplay experience...
I don't know about that man. I saw what it did to WOW.
Just curious, but could you elaborate on that? I don't play WoW, so I'm not sure what you're referring to.

After Cataclysm, people started leaving in droves. Largely because the game was so faceroll boring that it honestly wasn't fun. That's a different story, but the point is people were leaving. 

This about about 8 to 10 years into the game being out. As you can imagine, for those 8 to 10 years people were asking for a lot of things and they weren't getting much. All of a sudden:

* Pandas were a playable race
* A faction was released that could choose Horde or Alliance
* Worgen and Goblains were now a playable race
* Monk and Demon Hunters are now a playable class
* Old zones were revamped

Basically, they just threw everything at the player base like a guy who's begging his girlfriend not to break up with him. It was sad, and hamfisted. Those were great ideas that rushed out to stem the tide. 

As it related to LoL, taking away their money makes them do really stupid things. You'll start seeing towers that one-shot people, jungles with roaming creeps, 40 types of wards, TeamBuilder will come back, and all skins will be available all the time, with pay-to-boost brackets. 

Except like some evil genie, it will be instant and misconstrued to make your dreams nightmares.

well aside from pay to boost which will kill the competitive side of the game for sure which would end lol immediately

the rest doesn't sound half bad to be honest

Look, I don't want to sound like a crazy old man, but I assure you. It went really badly. 

Also, get off of my lawn.

I don't think it's the players leaving is the only thing killing WoW, and I say it in the progressive because the game is still taking its sweet time to die completely. I'm still playing it and having more fun than I have with LoL, but that's beside the point. 

Anyways, I feel like we should all realize that these games have limits. Blizzard's creativity has limits, especially when they also have to conform to years and years of lore. The PC platform also has limits--there's only so much you can do with a mouse and keyboard. Basically, video games aren't immortal; ideas might be bullet-proof, but they still have a life span. It's going to be the same thing with League eventually, all just a matter of time.
cant wait for LoL 2, getting that brain implant the day it comes out
With how this game is currently, you'd be better off having a lobotomy instead.
jokes on you (or is it me?), thats the new name of the procedure for lobotomies
huh....implant means putting something in, right? And lobotomy is destroying the brain?
wont matter, you wont remember what you went in for in the first place

So are you implying that he is giving games crabs?
That explains Scuttle...

>Pandas were a playable race

Let's not forget how that happened.  For those of you who don't know the full story, the first Non-NPC / non-mercenary Pandaren (not just reskinned Furbolgs) was first introduced in a bonus campaign in Warcraft 3: Frozen Throne as the new Brewmaster hero class with Chen Stormstout helping you (Rexxar.)  A year later, WoW launched at the end of 2004, and since that time, players had been saying things like "wouldn't it be cool to be Chen? It'd be funny to be a panda!" 

After the utter disaster that was Cataclysm, Blizzard had already done an April fools day mock update that teased pandas as a new race in the "next expansion."  After the numbers came back and they saw players were essentially abandoning the ship they sailed into an iceberg on purpose as they plugged their ears to the warnings, they panicked and made Pandaland the official expansion.  That alone was sad, but the fact that it was so rushed, and they were so desperate for fun elements to keep people playing (remember getting like a hundred toys that clogged your bags?) that they were willing to throw the kitchen sink at us in an attempt to stop the sinking ship made a lot of angry vets speechless.  

It started as a fucking JOKE, but they didn't know what else to do when a disgusted playerbase started leaving en mass.

What a load of shit. So because riot refuses to heed the voice of the market, but may fail a market-induced stress test, we're supposed to just keep giving money and pretend everything is fine when the current meta is obnoxious as shit?

I detest your lack of spine.

Fuck that, I went through that process with starcraft until it finally died out and blizzard just focused on HotS

Hey buddy, why all the salt?

I'm not saying you should spend money, it started as an off comment someone asked me to explain. 

Just the same, my point was democracy in general leads to some bad outcomes. If you like something - buy it. If you don't, don't. But if you continue to play the game for free while you hate it, I feel like that makes you something of a hypocrite. 

tl;dr - didn't put a ton of thought into the original comment. Not really a molehill I was planning to die on.

> [{quoted}](name=RookPusher,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=IKyYUuvK,comment-id=00010000000100010000,timestamp=2017-02-16T22:23:26.097+0000)

This is isn't government, this is economics. The market is not the people looking for a leader, it's a people looking to have a satisfactory experience in entertainment.

Democracy is a moot point.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bpMv76SIUhg

Just because the Market has a voice, doesn't mean it should be listened to. People detested Radio when it first came out, simply because it was new and different. People think Vaccines cause Autism. People think Fluoride in the water is going to turn our children into Nazi Zombies who are bad at math.

So what? Riot just continues to largely ignore the player base and our suggestions and ends up with a dead game in 5 years? Listening to the market should be a given if you want to have a healthy product that lasts.

Except, like said, that's not at all what you're talking about. What you're trying to "Boycott" is heavily subjective on how different people see it. What I see talking about in your OP is "I don't like how the game is being balanced, so I'm gonna not spend money so Riot balances it the way I want". 

You're not dissatisfied with an actual product, you're dissatisfied with a free Service. You not spending money on a free service isn't going to teach anyone anything. Unless you stop playing completely, you're not showing your point, as you're still creating the environment other people enjoy, and if other people enjoy, they're just as likely to recommend to their friends (keep in mind, not everyone shares your opinion). 

If you want to make  difference, stop playing the game, and don't recommend the game to friends. Your "spend with your dollar" only applies to an actual product.

except if the market is so varied with conflicting ideas, wants, and desires. To truly listen to such a large group of differing opinions would mean give them something , take it away in a month. Sometimes they have to try to find a happy medium and focus on the game itself , ease of play, ease of learning, entertainment factor, ect. And having been a former WoW player...careful what you wish for, you might get it and it may not always be everything you wished for.

> [{quoted}](name=Judge Steven,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=IKyYUuvK,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2017-02-16T17:37:57.190+0000)
>
> Just curious, but could you elaborate on that? I don't play WoW, so I'm not sure what you're referring to.

Same I'm confused by rook statement, I read game news from time to time and people did vote with their wallet, even though WoW still have a player base of 5-8 million they said it is a drop from 3-4 million players, it usually rise when a new expansion pack is out but always drops again after a month. So WoW is constantly losing players since Blizzard doesn't listen to the player base i guess which is what Riot is doing right now with the crap hired balance team they have right now.

I put $2000 into this game over the last year for my account. I like this game. Perks of haveing a great job. NOTE: If I knew what I know not I would have just bought an account off eBay with a lot of shit for like $400 and saved so much money. Lesson learned.
Lesson not learned apparently. If you buy an account you are at risk of getting permabanned

Interesting. Didn't know that. Now that seems kinda shitty. But then again I see dozens of accounts on ebay so someone has to be buying them. Would guess not that easy to prove an account is bought or sold. But I guess they have their ways.

>If you buy an account you are at risk of getting permabanned.

While this is true, it's partly just a cheeky phrasing on their part in the ToU: 
"Thou shalt not sell nor buy accounts" (mock rephrase).

They don't allow account trades on the claimed basis that the buyer might get swindled. 

That argument is all well and good on its own, but what they neglect to mention is that when an account is sold to another person directly, they lose potential income from the content that new person might otherwise have bought from them through RP purchases.
More to the point, buying accounts puts people into the wrong place on the ladder, messing with matchmaking and causing really unbalanced games, and no one wants that.

No arguments there. I just keep forgetting that fact becase I don't care about ranked myself.

http://68.media.tumblr.com/0d30a3aa7558702a43ce444cc10c2d94/tumblr_nbcr7nXl7c1shiin5o1_1280.jpg

_Though I maintain that they fear more for their money than the playerbase..._

relevant:

http://askghostcrawler.tumblr.com/post/157080214673/unsubbing-is-often-seen-as-the-only-real-way-by

Wow, thanks for posting the link. 

> My perception has been that the players and developers in the “We’ve changed too much!” camp tend to be those who are less engaged with the game than they once were.

So there are people who are falling away from the game... 

> a game like League tends to be more reliant on keeping current players than it is on attracting new ones.

And those people are important to hold on to... 

So instead of trying to hold on to those players by limiting change he's just ... 

> Yes, it is entirely possible to change so much that you drive players away, but we think the risk of stagnation is greater. So for League, the answer is usually double down.

Saying fuck it.... 

If he really believes that the way to avoid stagnation is to consistently make changes which remove half the champion roster then this game is doomed af. If anything all the change makes the game more stale because you only see a dozen viable champions at any given time anymore.

What he's saying is that older players aren't driven completely by nostalgia, a lot of people just get *bored*. Stagnation effects the older players more than the newer players. Especially the casual but old players.

This "vote with your wallet" notion only really works in certain scenarios, namely fairly regular purchases and a competitor to compare to.

If you buy RP only once every 6 months, how long will it take for Riot's stat guys to realize something's different with your spending pattern? How are they then suppose to realize that you're not buying RP because you want balance changes, as oppose to you don't like any of the skins available? How are they to even know the reason you're not buying RP has anything to do with the game at all? You might have stopped buying RP because your saving up for a different game, or buying a new car, or your rent went up, or you got a pay cut, or any number of other things.

Sending an email to Meddler would be more likely to get Riot's attention than stopping your once every 6 months purchase of RP.
Yep at the end of the day its a company and they wanna make money $$$$
Been doing that for quite a while now.

The problem is, those who are whining about it being the worst ever, are exactly what. Whiners.
Yes, lethality is absurdly strong this patch.
This patch.
2 weeks.
Not only that, they are a vocal MINORITY (very small minority as well). Riot should NEVER balance the game based on the complaints of a relatively small number of players.

If you want your posts to be noticed, actually include numbers, information. FACTS and shit work a lot better than WHINING.
If you complain about something without giving any idead, or information, then yes, you ARE WHINING.

(This is not specifically aimed at you OP, just at the boards users in general)

As they should...
I'm just saying but Boards is a minority..
A OUT spoken minority.
There's millions of League players, how many do you think are on boards.
